For $50, it is definitely expensive but I found a trick. I mix the gel with a moisturizer lotion or mist. It becomes super lightweight yet still effective and I save money. Dry skin beware! If you have dry skin, don’t waste your money on this product.

Yep I dropped it, and only after a couple months of use. This was completely my fault, but I decided to take off one star. I decided to do this, because I believe that the brand could have either reinforced the bag that’s meant to hold the stone or they could have recommended that the buyer could themselves. Mine was in its little bag as it slipped off the counter. I keep telling myself that maybe it would have helped cushion the fall if the bag had padding. I really hope that others can learn from my stupid mistake and make sure to be especially cautious if you decide to purchase this item. Before the heart wrenching loss, I was really seeing results and put in the effort and extra time to use it during my morning and night time routine. The “short term“ results right after using the stone really made my roundish face seem more contoured and defined (talking about my cheekbones) but it didn’t last long. I think with continued use the “long term“ results will have more of a lasting effect over time. I dread the thought of replacing my old one that’s in pieces, but I do believe that it’s something that’s worth repurchasing. I know I want to buy one for my mom and maybe my sister, but I think I’ll wait to buy myself another one to show respect to the one I broke.This review was all over the place but I hope it will be able to help someone.

review_text: Received complimentary from Paula’s Choice. Love the retinol products. Being over 40 and having fine lines and deeper ones on my forehead, always looking for a minimizer. This one does seem to make it thinner, which is great. It makes my skin shiner which is a good thing. Means it is working. No breakouts. Will definately continue.

This has been my favorite clean oil cleanser!Pros-I am sensitive to smells, and this doesn’t really have a scent-Not overtly oily. Yes, I know it’s an oil, but there are some oils out there that I swear always leave a residue, but not this one.-Lasts a while. I use this every night and it lasts me 4 months (I have on auto-ship)-Non-irritating. I saw a review that someone’s eyes stung when this got in their eyes but I haven’t had that problem even though I get them in my eyes a lot-VERY clean ingredient list (a requirement for all my skincare and makeup purchases)-Good packaging. Normally I don’t care but I leave this out on my sink so it’s one of the few products where that’s pretty important for me.Con-It isn’t the strongest at cleansing eye makeup. My eyeliner (Freck) is really tough to cleanse and I know other oil cleansers I have used in the past (but weren’t clean and/or stung my eyes)  did a better job. Not a deal breaker for me as I don’t wear makeup daily, but I can see how this would be really frustrating if you have a makeup heavy look daily. If I could knock down .5 stars on my rating for this, I would.Neutral-Though it doesn’t sting my eyes, when I do get it in my eyes, my vision gets blurry. I don’t think this is a full on con because I expect any type of oil getting in your eye will do that.

Had this been my first attempt at use I would have definitely been hesitant to use it again.

review_text: Let me preface this review by noting that I was generously gifted this cleansing brush from Sephora to try and give an honest review. It didn’t cause any breakouts or redness to my very sensitive face.-I liked how it wasn’t on a timer like the battery operated versions so I could use it as long or short as I liked.  -I liked that I could control the speed of movement and pressure with my own hand.-It is compact and easy for travel.  Its compact brush size also enables you to target specific small areas better than a cleansing brush with a bigger brush head.Cons:-While I liked that it is compact in size, the brush head is really small.  Therefore, cleansing your face takes more time and more effort than with a brush head with a larger surface area.-I didn’t find it to remove my makeup as well as I would have hoped.  I found it to work better after using makeup remover and then following up with the cleansing brush.-No directions for how to clean the brush or how often.Tips: I wold recommend applying the cleanser to your face first and lathering slightly with your hands. Then, use the cleansing brush with the cleanser already evenly distributed on your face. This kept me from having to use more cleanser than I would normally use and seemed to remove the remaining makeup best for me.Final thoughts: I’m not sure I would repurchase in the future only because I found it rather small and didn’t seem to do too much for me. I would recommend this to others who enjoy using cleansing brushes though. It is a good product. It’s just not a necessity for me.
